predicate.note: Frames file for 'dip' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 9.3, other framed members include dump, push, quash, shake, start; this is one of two possible senses. Framenet class Path_shape. Other sense not in Verbnet or Framenet. Comparison with push and fall.

example.name: intransitive unaccusative
example.text: Mercury attributed the loss to rapid prepayments of loans and costs incurred in refinancing many house loans this past spring and summer , when interest rates dipped.

example.name: all args
example.text: Sales dipped 3.6% to $3.92 billion from $4.07 billion.

example.name: doesn't actually occur in WSJ
example.text: John dipped his toe into the scalding hot bathwater.
